title: Madhubala
summary: Madhubala (born Mumtaz Jehan Begum Dehlavi; 14 February 1933 â€“ 23 February 1969) was an Indian actress and producer who worked in Hindi cinema.[1] In a career spanning 22 years, she starred in over 70 films and was noted by film critics for her beauty, comic timing, understated acting style and distinctive screen persona.[2][3] She first gained popularity in the late 1940s and became a major star as her career progressed, with David Cort of Theatre Arts Magazine calling her "the biggest star in the world" in 1952.[4] Long after her death, Madhubala continues to be held in high regard for her portrayals of independent and strong-willed characters, which are often seen as significantly different from regular depictions of women on the Indian screen.[5][6]
